lines.text: I put ketchup covered tampons in the trash.

[Kelly and Davis are fighting]
Now how would you two feel if something happened and you never saw each other again? You'd want this to be the last thing you said to each other?
After what that man did to us 35 years ago, this is nothing.
Let's just say I breathed a sigh of relief every night when my father came home.

[discarding her robe]
I think I still look best in my birthday suit.

[to a cop looking over her car]
What're you expecting to find back there, a big bag of money?
Mom, what're you doing in my room? Looking through my socks?
I was just looking, I wasn't looking for boy things, I was looking for... guns, knives, plastic explosives.
